By torey luvullo on Thursday, September 18, 2003 - 04:24 am:

S CLASS #3 BRACKET #1


I usually try to stay fairly mainstream in my morning lines. I usually try to find something good to say about every monster, and make my best case for how a close match will develop. But I can't do that this time. Might as well put my whole foot in my mouth as my toe...

MISO GETS TO WIN!!!


let's go thru the rigmarole...

MonsterBreedTrainerOdds
MisoCrab SaurianKimochi1-5
KabalCrab DragonRedHare8-1
ExzeeEmerald EyeGoGators8-1
RimowaCHBNoble Jell8-1


Miso pleads guilty to the charge of being a zuum. However, he is the only monster to effectively hide the inherent weakness of S class point deficit here. The others all have mismatched techs, or low speed, or both.

At this point i should try to say something nice about Kabal. I like dragons. It would behoove me to say something nice about Exzee as well. I like the screenshot. Finally, a word about Rimowa. Word.

MISO GETS TO WIN!!!
By Red Hare on Thursday, September 18, 2003 - 04:51 am:

I don't know why people liked Kabal so much.
His guts regen is horrible and his techs are expensive.
He has awfull SPD and being Skinny only serves to reduce his DEF.
Miso will probably win by time, unless Kabal get lucky and hit with one POwerful technique.
And when I say powerfull I don't mean exactly POW techs. Some INT techs are good for withering.
This bracket is so funny I won't be surprised if Kabal actually wins, but I wont be surprised if he ends as last one either.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Saturday, September 20, 2003 - 06:19 am:

I've not had a lot of luck in this 'guessing' thing, but I'm going to give this one a try again, just for the fun of it.

First: Kabal. The dragon's big disadvantage is going to come in its guts regen rate. Those attacks _are_ expensive, and they won't be thrown too often. However, he's got the advantage of being one of the hardest hitters up close. If the dragon can take this battle into first range, then he's got a BIG advantage against the Royal Jell.

And speaking of which: Rimowa's going to have some work to do, keeping himself _out_ of that critical first range. The Royal Jell's not got anything at that level that'll do anything more than sting. If he stays at a distance, or throws fast, though, that Jell Copter is going to come into play and prove its worthiness. It's a strong tech, and he may get to prove just _how_ strong. I don't pick him as a winner, but a strong second.

Exzee's a proud little Hopper. He's got some real firepower in that first row. Unfortunately, his mix of lower defense stats could well be a big hinderence. I see him possibly doing really well against the Jell, and slapping around the dragon some, but ultimately it's going to be his downfall. Still! A worthy member of the hopper race! My hats off to GoGators on this monster.

This leaves Miso, our Crab Saurian. Zuum moves have one big advantage: they have hard-hitting techs in all ranges, rather than just one range. While this gives them a big disadvantage in the market tourneys (since it means you have to go through a lot of weak to get to the good), it should give this fellow the edge on a lot of his competition. Add in his balanced stats and the only big problem that he will have is the sluggish guts regen that an arrowhead can bring. I still think that he's a strong contender for #1, though.

I'm with most folks. The big cup will bne taken by one of the two crab subs. I'm plucking for Kabal, myself, but it's really anyone's game.
